intro: Sisymbrium rhedonense, commonly known as the Rhedonese mustard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and slender, branching stems. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant produces small, round pods containing several seeds. Sisymbrium rhedonense is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands.
